question: Explain the role of KVM (Kernel-based Virtual Machine) in Linux virtualization and how it differs from a Type-2 hypervisor.
correct_answer: KVM transforms the Linux kernel into a Type-1 hypervisor, allowing direct hardware access for VMs, whereas Type-2 hypervisors run as software applications on top of an OS.
